title: What is the connection between Eckart Tolle, Stuart Hameroff, and the ancient knowledge of the Pythagoreans regarding the power of consciousness and time?
first_phrase: The last 200 tokens of this text explore the relationship between modern scientific knowledge and ancient wisdom regarding time and consciousness. The author argues that the analysis of physical reality shows that matter is immaterial, and that the linear and one-dimensional concept of time is an illusion created by the mind. The text refers to the wisdom of ancient traditions such as hermetism and pitagorism, as well as to modern scientific developments, including quantum physics and studies on consciousness. The goal of spiritual practices, such as the Grande Opera, is to transcend time and perceive reality beyond the limitations of our temporal perception.

last_phrase: In conclusion, symbols are powerful tools that operate on multiple levels of reality and have been used for centuries to connect with higher dimensions and expand consciousness. By understanding and working with symbols, we can access a deeper understanding of the world around us and tap into the inherent power of the universe. From ancient philosophers to modern quantum theorists, symbols have been recognized as a key to unlocking the secrets of the universe. By incorporating them into our daily lives through exercises of vivification and living in the moment, we can begin to access the timeless dimension beyond our usual perceptions of reality.
